program: Honours Bachelor of Science in Nursing
option: Bridging Pathway – Algonquin College, Pembroke Campus
notes: You can take up to 48 units at the 1000 level.
Please enroll for clinical placements by the clinical enrolment dates.
Clinical placements may occur during the day, the evening, on weekends and some may extend until the months of May and June.
Registration requirements for clinical placements. For more information on the additional program requirements, contact a Faculty of Health Sciences clinical placement risk management adviser.
All NSG courses require a passing mark of C+.
Students admitted with transfer credits at admission are requested to contact the Academic Office to review their course sequence.

If you want to complete your program requirements in four years, it’s important to follow this course sequence. If you fail, withdraw from or change a course in this sequence, it could lead to a delay in completing your program requirements.
All courses for this program are to be completed at Pembroke campus (except the HSS2382 which will be offered online by the uOttawa main campus).

Fall-Winter: ANP1105 | Human Anatomy and Physiology I
ANP1106 | Human Anatomy and Physiology II
ANP1107 | Human Anatomy and Physiology III

Fall: HSS2381 or HSS2382 | Quantitative Methods in Health Sciences
PHI1370 or PHI2396 | Philosophical Issues in Health Care or Bioethics
Winter: NSG2105 | Transition to the Role of Registered Nurse

Fall: NSG3107 | Family-Centered Care of Children with Acute and Chronic Illness
NSG3111 | Care of the Childbearing Family
NSG3307 | Practicum: Family-Centered Care of Children
Winter: NSG3105 | Care of Adults Experiencing Illness
NSG3305 | Practicum: Care of Adults Experiencing Illness

Fall: NSG4430 | Practicum: Complex Nursing Care (6 units)
Winter: NSG4134 | Political and Economic Contexts of Health Care
